data.title: Marlborough
data.text:
Also Spencer, Earls of Sunderland

Part 1

Sir John Spencer, of Wormleighton and Althorp, d.8 Nov 1586; m.Catherine Kitson

1a) Sir John, of Wormleighton and Althorp, d.9 Jan 1599; m.Mary Catlyn [Catelin]

1b) Sir Robert, of Wormleighton and Althorp, cr 1603 Baron Spencer of Wormleighton (1570-Wormleighton 25 Oct 1627); m.Brington 15 Feb 1588 Margaret Willoughby (d.17 Aug 1597)

1c) John (ca 1590-Aug 1610)

2c) William, 2nd Lord Spencer (bap 4 Jan 1592-19 Dec 1636); m.1615 Lady Penelope Wriothesley (ca 1598-16 Jul 1667)

1d) Elizabeth (16 Feb 1618-11 Aug 1672); m.Brington 4 Dec 1634 John Craven, 1643 Lord Craven of Ryton (bap 10 Jun 1610-1647/8); m.2nd 1648 Hon. Henry Howard (d.Dec 1663); m.3rd William Crofts, Lord Crofts of Saxham (ca 1611-11 Sep 1677)

2d) Henry, 3rd Lord Spencer, cr 6 Jun 1643 Earl of Sunderland (bap 23 Nov 1620-k.a.Newbury20 Sep 1643); m.Penshurst 20 Jul 1639 Lady Dorothy Sydney (bap 5 Oct 1617-bur.25 Feb 1684)

1e) Robert, 2nd Earl of Sunderland (Paris 1641-Althorp 28 Sep 1702); m.London 10 Jun 1665 Lady Anne Digby (d.16 Apr 1715)

1f) Robert, Lord Spencer (bap 2 May 1666-Paris5 Sep 1688)

2f) Anne (24 Jun 1666-Kinneil House, co Linlithgow 2 Jul 1690); m.James Hamilton, Earl of Arran [later, Duke of Hamilton and Brandon] (11 Apr 1658-15 Nov 1712)

3f) Elizabeth, d.Jun 1704; m.London 31 Dec 1684 Donogh Maccarty, 4th Earl of Clancarty (d.1 Oct 1734)

4f) Charles, 3rd Earl of Sunderland (ca 1674-Sunderland House 19 Apr 1722); m.1st 12 Jan 1695-Lady Arabella Cavendish (19 Aug 1673-4 Jun 1698); m.2nd 2 Jan 1700 Lady Anne Churchill (27 Feb 1683-15 Apr 1716; see Part 2 for her); m.3rd 5/16 Dec 1717 Judith Tichborne (d.17 May 1749), niece of Lord Ferrard; see Part 3 for his issue by 2nd wife

[by 1st m.]:

1g) Frances, d.27 Jul 1742; m.27 Nov 1717 Henry Howard, 4th Earl of Carlisle (1694-3 Sep 1758)

[by 2nd m.]:

see Part 3, below

5f) Henry, d.an infant

6f) Isabella, d.1684

7f) Mary, d. aged 5

2e) Dorothy, d.London 16 Dec 1670; m.London 29 Dec 1656 George Savile, Viscount Halifax [later, Earl and Marquess of Halifax] (11 Nov 1633-5 Apr 1695)

3e) Penelope, born posthumously, and d. an infant

3d) Mary (bap 20 Feb 1621-12 Jul 1622)

4d) Anne; m.Sir Robert Townshend

5d) Katherine (bap 17 Oct 1624- )

6d) Alice (bap 29 Dec 1625-d.between 1696 and 1712); m.Henry Moore, Earl of Drogheda (d.12 Jan 1676)

7d) Margaret (bap 19 Jul 1627-1693); m.London 30 Aug 1655 Anthony Ashley Cooper, Earl of Shaftesbury (22 Jul 1621-Amsterdam21 Jan 1683)

8d) Robert, cr 1685 Viscount Teviot (bap 2 Feb 1629-20 May 1694); m.Jane Spencer (below)

9d) William, of Ashton; m.Hon. Elizabeth Gerrard

1e) Elizabeth; m.Robert Hesketh, of Rufford

10d) Richard (bap 3 Oct 1631-bur.11 Feb 1658)

11d) Thomas, d.young

12d) John, d.young

13d) Rachel (bap 19 Jul 1637-d.young)

3c) Richard, of Orpington; m.NN

1d) Mary; m.William Gee, of Bishop Burton (1625-Aug 1678)

4c) Sir Edward; m.Mary, widow of Sir William Reade

5c) Mary; m.Sir Richard Anderson, of Penley

6c) Elizabeth; m.Sir George Fane, of Buston

7c) Margaret

2a) Thomas, of Claredon [Claverdon], d.8 Nov 1580; m.Mary Cheeke

1b) Alice; m.Sir Thomas Lucy, of Charlecote

3a) Sir William, of Yarnton [Yardington], d.18 Dec 1609; m.Margaret Bowyer (d.19 Jun 1608)

1b) Thomas, of Yarnton, cr Baronet 1611 (ca 1586-7 Aug 1622); m.ca 1605 Margaret Brainthwait (d.16 Dec 1655), later wife of Viscount Mountgarret

1c) Sir William, 2nd Bt. (ca 1608-May 1647); m.ca 1635 Constance Lucy (ca 1614- )

1d) Sir Thomas, 3rd Bt. (1 Jan 1639-6 Mar 1685); m.London 24 Jan 1655 Jane Garrard (d.30 Mar 1712); he had nine children, of whom five survived; his estates went to his daughters, and not with the title

1e) William, dvpsp 13 Sep 1683

2e) Thomas, d.young

3e) Thomas, d.young

4e) Jane, d.young

5e) Margaret, d.young

6e) Jane, d.10 Jun 1689; m.Robert Spencer, Viscount Teviot (1629-1694; above)

7e) Constance; m.George Marwood (bap 27 Jul 1665-dvp, bur 12 Nov 1700),only son of Sir Henry Marwood, 2nd Bt.

8e) Elizabeth; [?per Extinct Baronetage and Wotton’s 1741 Baronetage, she married 1stly “Sir Samuel Gerard, of Brafferton”; per Collins she m. “Sir Samuel Gerrard, of Brafferton”; per the Basset article in 1937 LG she was widow of “Sir Samuel Garrard, 4th Bt., of Lamer”; however, no such marriage is listed in the Garrard articles in Complete Baronetage, Extinct Baronetage, or Burke’s Commoners]; m.2nd Francis Basset, of Tehidy (d.11 Dec 1721)

9e) Catherine; m.1st John Dormer; m.2nd Rev. Hon. George Mordaunt (d.28 Jul 1728)

10e) [illegitimate] Margaret, d.22 Jul 1706; m.Hon. Harry Mordaunt (ca 1663-4 Jan 1720)

2d) Constance; m.Sir Edward Smith, of Edmundthorpe, Bt. (d.6 Sep 1707)

3d) Alice; m.Francis Keyt, of Mickleton

2c) Thomas

3c) John

4c) Richard (bap 2 Feb 1617- ); m.Anne Wagstaffe

1d) Sir Thomas, 4th Bt., d.ca 1722; m.Elizabeth Palmer à 7 sons, 6 daus, of whom:

1e) Sir Henry, 5th Bt., d.Startford-upon-Avon 1726

2e) Sir Thomas, 6th Bt., dspm ca 1735; m.Elizabeth Dee

3e) Ursula; m.Hugh Philips

2d) Charles, of Lyons Hall; m.Anne Pember

1e) Sir Charles, 7th Bt., fl 1741, dsp before 1771

3d) Mary; m. ___ Richards

4d) Gertrude; m.1st John Crump; m.2nd Essex Sherborne

5c) Edward

6c) Alice

7c) Anne

8c) Margaret

9c) Catherine

2b) George

3b) Elizabeth; m.Sir Thomas Russell, of Strensham

4b) Catherine, d.7 Dec 1612; m.1 Jun 1601 Sir Henry Montagu [later Earl of Manchester] (d.7 Nov 1642)

5b) Mary; m.Sir Maximilian Dalison

6b) Alice; m.Sir Thomas Colville

7b) Margaret; m.Sir John Woodward

4a) Sir Richard, of Offley; m.Helen Brocket

1b) John, of Offley, cr Baronet 1627, d.Aug 1633; m.Mary Anderson (bap 29 Feb 1596- ), whose brother m. Hon. Mary Spencer

1c) Alice; m.Sir James Altham

2b) Brocket, of Offley, cr Baronet 1642 (ca 1605-3 Jul 1668); m.by 1646 Susan Carew (bap 8 Jul 1619-9 May 1692)

1c) Sir Richard, 2nd Bt. (ca 1647-21 Feb 1688); m.Hornsey, Middlesex 23 Jul 1672 Mary Musters (d.1719)

1d) Sir John, 3rd Bt, (bap 27 Feb 1678-6 Aug 1699)

2c) Sir John, 4th Bt. (ca 1650-16 Nov 1712)

3c) Elizabeth; m.2 Nov 1677 Sir Humphrey Gore, of Gilston

4c) Susanna, dsp; m.Abraham Nelson

5c) Anne, dsp; m.Roger Meredith

6c) Alice, dsp; m.Granado Pigott, of Abington Pigott

3b) Elizabeth [or Helen], d.by 1678; m.Sir William Colepeper, Bt. (d.1651)

4b) Anne; m.Sir John Boteler

5b) Alice; m.Sir John Jenyns [Jennings] (d.1642); they were grandparents of Sarah Jennings, Dss of Marlborough (below)

5a) Edward

6a) Margaret; m.1st Giles Alington; m.2nd Edward Eldrington

7a) Elizabeth; m.1st ca 1574 George Carey, 2nd Lord Hunsdon (d.8 Sep 1603); m.2nd Ralph Eure, 3rd Lord Eure (24 Sep 1558-1 Apr 1617)

8a) Catherine; m.Sir Thomas Leigh, of Stoneleigh

9a) Mary; m.Sir Edward Aston

10a) Anne, d.22 Sep 1618; m.1st William Stanley, 3rd Lord Monteagle (d.10 Nov 1581); m.2nd Henry, Lord Compton (16 Feb 1538-bur10 Dec 1589); m.3rd 4 Dec 1592 Robert Sackville, 2nd Earl of Dorset (1561-27 Feb 1609)

11a) Alice, d.23 Jan 1637; m.1st Ferdinando Stanley, 5th Earl of Derby (d.16 Apr 1594); m.2nd 20 Oct 1600 Thomas Egerton, Viscount Brackley (1540-15 Mar 1617)

Part 2: Churchill:

Sir Winston Churchill (1620-26 Mar 1688) m.Elizabeth Drake [daughter of Sir John Drake, of Ashe, by Hon. Helena Boteler, herself the daughter of John, Lord Boteler, by Elizabeth Villiers], and had issue:

1a) Winston, d.young

2a) John (Ashe 24 Jun 1650-Cranbourne Lodge, Windsor 16 Jun 1722); cr 1682 Baron Churchill of Eyemouth, cr 1685 Baron Churchill of Sandridge, cr 1689 Earl of Marlborough, cr 1702 Duke of Marlborough and Marquess of Blandford; cr 1705 Fürst von Mindelheim, exchanged 1713 for Mellenburg; in 1706 he obtained an amended remainder of his British titles in favor of: 1st, his heirs male; 2nd, his daughters and their heirs male, by primogeniture; 3rd, the daughters of his daughters, by primogeniture, and their heirs male; and 4th, to “all and every other issue…”; he m.1 Oct 1678 Sarah Jennings (Holywell, Herts 5 Jun 1660-18 Oct 1744; granddaughter of Alice Spencer (see above))

1b) HENRIETTA, 2nd Duchess of Marlborough, etc (19 Jul 1681-24 Oct 1733); m.23 Apr 1698 Francis Godolphin, 2nd Earl of Godolphin (Whitehall3 Sep 1678-17 Jan 1766)

1c) William, Marquess of Blandford (1700-Oxford 24 Aug 1731); m.25 Apr 1729 Maria Catherina de Jong (d.Sheen 7 Sep 1779)

2c) Henry, d.young

3c) Henrietta (d.17 Jul 1776); m.2 Apr 1717 Thomas Pelham-Holles, Duke of Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Duke of Newcastle-under-Line (1 Jul 1693-London17 Nov 1768)

4c) Margaret, d.young

5c) Mary (d.3 Aug 1764); m.London 26 Jun 1740 Thomas Osborne, 4th Duke of Leeds (6 Nov 1713-London 23 Mar 1789); the direct male descendants of this marriage were in remainder to the Marlborough titles until such male descendants became extinct in 1964; it is said that Mary’s biological father may have been the dramatist, William Congreve

2b) Anne (27 Feb 1683-15 Apr 1716); m.2 Jan 1700 Charles Spencer, 3rd Earl of Sunderland (ca 1674-Sunderland House 19 Apr 1722); see Part 1 for his ancestry, and Part 3 for their descendants

3b) John, Lord Churchill (13 Feb 1686-Cambridge20 Feb 1703)

4b) Elizabeth (15 Mar 1688-22 Mar 1714); m.9 Feb 1703 Scroop Egerton, 4th Earl [cr Duke 1720] of Bridgwater (11 Aug 1681-11 Jan 1745)

1c) Lady Anne Egerton (d.London 15 Jun 1762); m.1st Ashridge, Bucks 22 Apr 1725 Wriothesley Russell, 3rd Duke of Bedford (25 May 1708-Corunna, Spain23 Oct 1732); m.2nd London23 Jun 1733 William Villiers, 3rd Earl of Jersey (d.28 Aug 1769)

5b) Mary (15 Jul 1689-14 May 1751); m.17 Mar 1705 John Montagu, 2nd Duke of Montagu (Boughton 29 Mar 1690-London 6 Jul 1749); they had three sons who died young, a daughter, Isabella, Duchess of Manchester, who died without issue, and another daughter, Mary, Duchess of Montagu, who died without surviving male issue

[?6b) the 1st Duke of Marlborough may have been father of Barbara, dau of the Dss of Cleveland, though the paternity is usually assigned to King Charles II]

3a) Adm. George Churchill (1653-8 May 1710)

1b) [illegitimate] George Churchill, d.1745; m.Catherine (d.2 Jun 1725), dau of Sir Henry Hobart, 4th Bt.

4a) Charles Churchill (2 Feb 1656-29 Dec 1714); m.1702 Mary Gould, later wife of Earl of Abingdon

1b) [illegitimate] Gen. Charles Churchill (1679-1745)

1c) [illegitimate by Anne Oldfield, actress (1683-1730)] Charles Churchill (1720-1812); m.1746 Lady Mary Walpole

1d) Charles Churchill (1747-1785)

2d) Robert Churchill (1748- )

3d) George Churchill (d.1808)

4d) Mary Churchill (1750- ); m.10 May 1777 (div 1796) Charles Sloane Cadogan, 3rd Lord Cadogan [later, Earl Cadogan] (29 Sep 1728-3 Apr 1807)

5d) Horatio Churchill (1759-1817); m.1783 Harriot Ann Modigliani (d.1840)

6d) Henry Churchill

7d) Sophia Churchill (d.9 Nov 1797); m.1781 Horatio Walpole, 2nd Earl of Orford

2c) [illegitimate] Harriet Churchill (1726-1777); m.1st 1747 Sir Everard Fawkener; m.2nd 1765 Hon. Thomas Pownall; her daughter, Henrietta Fawkener (1751-1825), married 1st Hon. Edward Bouverie, and m.2nd Lord Robert Spencer (below)

5a) Montjoy, d.young

6a) Jasper, d.young

7a) Rev. Theobald, d.3 Dec 1685

8a) Arabella Churchill, mistress of King James II (d.Bath 23 Feb 1714); m.Charles Godfrey à issue by her marriage and also by the King

9a) Dorothy, d. an infant

10a) Mary, d. an infant

11a) Barbara, d. an infant

Part 3: Spencer and Spencer-Churchill Dukes of Marlborough:

The members of this family bear the surname Churchill, Spencer, Spencer-Churchill, or other variations, as noted. The children of the Dukes of Marlborough and Marquesses of Blandford, and the daughters of the Earls of Sunderland and Earls Spencer enjoy the title Lord/Lady before their Christian names. The sons of the Earls of Sunderland and Earls Spencer, and all the children of the Lords and Viscounts Churchill and of the Baroness Spencer-Churchill have the prefix "Honourable" before their Christian names.

Charles Spencer, 3rd Earl of Sunderland (ca 1674-Sunderland House 19 Apr 1722; see above, Part 1) and his second wife, Lady Anne Churchill (27 Feb 1683-15 Apr 1716; see above, Part 2) had issue:

1a) Robert, Lord Spencer (2 Dec 1700-12 Sep 1701)

2a) Robert, 4th Earl of Sunderland (24 Oct 1701-Paris15 Sep 1729)

3a) CHARLES, 3rd Duke of Marlborough, 5th Earl of Sunderland, etc (22 Nov 1706-Münster20 Oct 1758); m.East Barnet 23 May 1732 Hon Elizabeth Trevor (d.7 Oct 1761)

1b) Diana (24 Mar 1734-Aug 1808); m.1st Harbledown, Kent8 Sep 1757 (div 1768) Frederick St.John, 2nd Viscount Bolingbroke (1734-5 May 1787); m.2nd 12 Mar 1768 Topham Beauclerk (Nov 1739-11 Mar 1780)

2b) Elizabeth (29 Dec 1737-Pembroke Lodge, RichmondPark, Surrey30 Apr 1831); m.Langley, Bucks 12/13 Mar 1756 Henry Herbert, 10th Earl of Pembroke and Montgomery (Whitehall16 Jul 1734-Wilton26 Jan 1794)

3b) GEORGE, 4th Duke of Marlborough, etc (London 26 Jan 1739-Blenheim 29 Jan 1817); m.London 23 Aug 1762 Lady Caroline Russell (Jan 1743-Blenheim 26 Nov 1811)

1c) Caroline (27 Oct 1763-Blenheim23 Nov 1813); m.Sion House 10 Mar 1792 Henry Welbore Agar Ellis, 2nd Viscount Clifden (22 Jan 1761-London13 Jul 1836)

2c) Elizabeth (20 Dec 1764 [1772?]-1812); m.Blenheim 5 Feb 1790 John Spencer (below)

3c) GEORGE, 5th Duke of Marlborough, etc, took surname Spencer-Churchill 1817 (6 Mar 1766-Blenheim5 Mar 1840); m.London 15 Sep 1791 Lady Susan Stewart (20 Apr 1767-London2 Apr 1841)

1d) GEORGE, 6th Duke of Marlborough, etc (Bill Hill, Wokingham, Berks 27 Dec 1793- Blenheim 1 Jul 1857); m.1st London 13 Jan 1819 Lady Jane Stewart (29 Mar 1798- Blenheim 12 Oct 1844); m.2nd Lambeth Palace 10 Jun 1846 Hon. Charlotte Augusta Flower (London 25 Nov 1818 [per GEC; 1828 Debrett’s and 1861 Lodge say 26 Nov 1818]-London 20 Apr 1850); m.3rd Blenheim 18 Oct 1851 Jane Frances Clinton Stewart (London 27 May 1817-London 24 Mar 1897)

1e) Louisa (2 Jan 1821-23 Mar 1882); m.4 Jul 1845 Hon Robert Spencer (d.17 Jun 1881)

2e) JOHN WINSTON, 7th Duke of Marlborough, etc (Garboldisham Hall 2 Jun 1822-London 5 Jul 1883); m.London 12 Jul 1843 Lady Frances Anne Emily Vane (London 15 Apr 1822-London 16 Apr 1899)

1f) GEORGE CHARLES, 8th Duke of Marlborough, etc (London 13 May 1844-Blenheim 9 Nov 1892); m.1st Westminster Abbey 8 Nov 1869 (div 1883) Lady Albertha Frances Anne Hamilton (London 29 Jul 1847-London 7 Jan 1932); m.2nd New York29 Jun 1888 Lilian Warren Price (Troy NY 10 Jun 1854-Deepdene 11 Jan 1909)

1g) Frances Louisa (Simla 15 Sep 1870-Hove 13 Nov 1954); m.London 6 Jun 1893 Sir Robert Gresley, 11th Bt. (London 1 Feb 1866-27 Dec 1936)

2g) CHARLES RICHARD JOHN, 9th Duke of Marlborough, etc (Simla, India 13 Nov 1871-London 30 Jun 1934); m.1st New York6 Nov 1895 (div 1921) Consuelo Vanderbilt (New York 1870-6 Dec 1964); m.2nd Paris25 Jun 1921 Gladys Marie Deacon (Paris 1881- Northampton Hospital 13 Oct 1977)

1h) JOHN ALBERT EDWARD WILLIAM, 10th Duke of Marlborough, etc (London 18 Sep 1897-London 11 Mar 1972); m.1st London17 Feb 1920 Hon Alexandra Mary Cadogan (22 Feb 1900-Blenheim23 May 1961); m.2nd 26 Jan 1972 Frances Laura Charteris (London 10 Aug 1915-London 19 Feb 1990)

1i) Sarah Consuelo (London 17 Dec 1921-Connecticut 13 Oct 2000); m.1st St.Margaret's, Westminster15 May 1943 (div 1966) Edwin Russell (d.Florida 23 Dec 2001); m.2nd New York11 Nov 1966 (div 1967) Guy Burgos; m.3rd Philadelphia 1967 Theodoros Roubanis

2i) Caroline (London 12 Nov 1923-5 Jan 1992); m.Woodstock 5 Dec 1946 Charles Huguenot “Hugh” Waterhouse (11 Jun 1918-Rievaulx, No Yorkshire15 Jul 2007)

3i) JOHN GEORGE VANDERBILT HENRY, 11th Duke of Marlborough, etc (London 13 Apr 1926-16 Oct 2014); m.1st St. Margaret's, Westminster 19 Oct 1951 (div 1960) Susan Mary Hornby (19 Oct 1929-27 Jan 2005); m.2nd Paris 23 Oct 1961 (rel) Greek Orthodox Church of St.Etienne, Passy, Paris 23 Oct 1961 (div 1971) Athina Livanos (19 Mar 1926-Paris 10 Oct 1974); m.3rd Charlbury, Oxon 20 May 1972 (div 2008) Dagmar Gfn Douglas (b.Madrid 26 Sep 1943); m.4th 2008 Mrs Lily Mahtani

1j) John David Ivor, Earl of Sunderland (London 17 Nov 1952-Radcliffe Imfirmary, Oxford 14 May 1955)

2j) CHARLES James, 12th Duke of Marlborough (b.Radcliffe Infirmary, Oxford24 Nov 1955); m.1st Woodstock24 Feb 1990 (div 1998) Rebecca Mary Few Brown; m.2nd Woodstock 1 Mar 2002 Edla Griffiths

1k) George, Marquess of Blandford (b.28 Jul 1992);m.Woodstock 8 Sep 2018 Camilla Thorp

1l) Olympia (b.2020)

2k) Araminta Clementine Megan (b.Apr 2007)

3k) Caspar Sasha Ivor (b.Sep 2008)

3j) Henrietta Mary (b.7 Oct 1958); m.Church of St.Mary Magdalene, Woodstock 14 Mar 1980 (div 1989) Nathan Gelber

4j) Richard (b.and d.1973)

5j) Edward Albert Charles (b.Oxford 19 Aug 1974); m.4 Jull 2018 (rel) Blenheim 7 Jul 2018 Kimberly Hammerström

6j) Alexandra Elizabeth Mary (b.1977)

4i) Rosemary Mildred (b.London 24 Jul 1929); m.Oxford 26 Jun 1953 Charles Robert Muir (d.24 Mar 1972)

5i) Charles George William Colin (London 13 Jul 1940-21 Dec 2016); m.1st 23 Jul 1965 (div 1968) Gillian Fuller; m.2nd 9 Dec 1970 Elizabeth Wyndham (b.17 Jan 1948); m.3rd Blenheim 19 Sep 2014 Sarah Goodbody

1j) Rupert John Harold Mark (b.1971)

2j) Dominic Albert Charles (b.London 15 Dec 1979); m.23 Jul 2011 Claire Gillian Troughton (b.1982)

1k) Martha Melissa (b.2012)

2k) Ivor Charles Robert (b.2014)

3j) Alexander David (b.9 Jun 1983); m.Scarlett Strutt

1k) Jake Charles Winston, b.2017

2h) Ivor Charles (London 14 Oct 1898-17 Sep 1956); m.London 15 Nov 1947 Elizabeth Cunningham (d.Winchester 12 Aug 2010)

1i) Robert William Charles (b.Southwark 7 Feb 1954); m.Southwark Cathedral 6 Jul 1979 Jeanne Maze

1j) John Robert (b.1984)

2j) Ivor Charles (b.1986)

3g) Lilian Maud (London 9 Jul 1873-Sunningdale 4 Jan 1951); m.London 8 Oct 1898 Cecil Alfred Grenfell (London 13 Feb 1864-11 Aug 1924)

4g) Norah Beatrice Henriette (Blenheim 1 Sep 1875-Hove 28 Apr 1946); m.London 1 Dec 1920 Francis Bradley Bradley-Birt (25 Jun 1874-11 Jun 1963)

2f) Frederick John Winston (2 Feb 1846-5 Aug 1850)

3f) Cornelia Henrietta Maria (Blenheim 17 Sep 1847-London 22 Jan 1927); m.London 25 May 1868 Ivor Bertie Guest, Lord Wimborne (Dowlais 29 Aug 1835-Canford Manor 22 Feb 1914)

4f) Randolph Henry (Blenheim 13 Feb 1849-London 24 Jan 1895); m.Paris 15 Apr 1874 Jennie Jerome (New York 1854-London 29 Jun 1921)

1g) Sir Winston Leonard, Prime Minister 1940-5 and 1951-5 (Blenheim 30 Nov 1874-London 24 Jan 1965); m.London 12 Sep 1908 Clementine Ogilvy Hozier, cr 1965 Baroness Spencer-Churchill (London 1 Apr 1885- 12 Dec 1977)

1h) Diana (London 11 Jul 1909-Chester Row, Belgravia, London 19 Oct 1963); m.1st London12 Dec 1932 (div 1935) John Milner Bailey [later, 1940, 2nd Bt.] (East Grinstead 15 Jun 1900-Cape Town 13 Feb 1946); m.2nd London16 Sep 1935 (div 1960) Edwin Duncan Sandys [cr 1974 Lord Duncan-Sandys] (24 Jan 1908-Westminster26 Nov 1987)

2h) Randolph Frederick Edward (London 28 May 1911-Stour, East Bergholt, Suffolk 6 Jun 1968); m.1st London 4 Oct 1939 (div 1946) Hon Pamela Beryl Digby (Farnborough Park 20 Mar 1920-Paris 4 Feb 1997); m.2nd London 2 Nov 1948 (div 1961) June Osborne (1920 [26 Jun 1922?]-Kensington 18 Jun 1980; note: though one source gives her date of birth as 1920, press reports at her death gave her age as 57)

1i) Winston (Chequers 10 Oct 1940-2 Mar 2010); m.1st Kensington Register Office 15 Jul 1964 (div 1997) Mary d'Erlanger; m.2nd New York 25 Jul 1997 Mrs Luce Danielson, née Engelen

1j) Randolph Leonard (b.22 Jan 1965); m.St.Mary's Church, Westerham, Kent21 Mar 1992 Catherine Zoe Lancaster (d.10 Jun 2022)

1k) Serena Barbara (b.12 May 1996)

2k) Zoe Lancaster (b.29 Oct 1998)

3k) Alice Grace (b.28 Apr 2003)

4k) John Winston (b.30 Mar 2007)

2j) Jennie (b.Westminster Hospital 25 Sep 1966); m.St.Mary's Church, Westerham, Kent 16 Oct 1993 James Repard

3j) Marina (b.Westminster Hospital 11 Sep 1967); m.2000 David W J Brounger

4j) John Gerard Averell (b.27 Aug 1975); m.2005 Charlotte May Baber

1k) Edward Ian (b.2008)

2k) Emilia Rose (b.2010)

3k) Alexander Robert (b.2014)

2i) Arabella (London 31 Oct 1949-20 Dec 2007); m.1st 10 Aug 1972 James Barton; m.2nd 1988 Ian McLeod

3h) Sarah Millicent Hermione (London 7 Oct 1914-London 24 Sep 1982); m.1st New York 25 Dec 1936 (div 1945) Victor Oliver Frhr von Samek (Vienna 8 Jul 1898- ); m.2nd London 18 Oct 1949 Antony Beauchamp Entwistle (d.18 Aug 1957); m.3rd Gibraltar 26 Apr 1962 Thomas Percy Henry Touchet Tuchet-Jesson, 23rd Lord Audley (15 Sep 1913-Granada 3 Jul 1963)

4h) Marigold Frances (15 Nov 1918-23 Aug 1921)

5h) Mary (London 15 Sep 1922-31 May 2014); m.London 11 Feb 1947 Christopher Soames, Lord Soames (Ashwell Manor 12 Oct 1920-Hampshire 16 Sep 1987)

2g) John Strange (London 9 Feb 1880-London 23 Feb 1947); m.Oxford 8 Aug 1908 Lady Gwendoline Theresa Mary Bertie (Abingdon 20 Nov 1885-Windsor 7 Jul 1941)

1h) John George (London 31 May 1909-1992); m.1st 13 May 1934 (div 1938) Angela Mary Culme Seymour (3 Aug 1912-22 Jan 2012); m.2nd 20 May 1941 (div 1953) Mary Cookson (b.10 May 1916); m.3rd 5 Mar 1953 Kathlyn Beddall (d.25 Jun 1957); m.4th 27 Aug 1958 (div 1972) Anna Gunvor Maria Janson

1i) Sarah Cornelia (b.London 26 Mar 1935); m.19 Nov 1957 James Colin Crewe (1922-10 Apr 2015); m.2d 1987 John Francis Harcourt Baring, 7th Lord Ashburton (b.2 Nov 1928)

2h) Henry Winston (London 25 May 1913-19 Mar 2002); m.1st 15 Nov 1954 Patricia Ethel Louise March (d.22 Oct 1956); m.2nd 21 Dec 1957 Yvonne Henriette Jéhannin (d.London 14 Dec 2010)

3h) Anne Clarissa Spencer-Churchill (London 28 Jun 1920-15 Nov 2021); m.London 14 Aug 1952 Robert Anthony Eden, Earl of Avon, Prime Minister (Windlestone 12 Jun 1897-Alvediston Manor 14 Jan 1977)

5f) Rosamond Jane Frances (London 9 Nov 1851-3 Dec 1920); m.London 12 Jul 1877 William Henry Fellowes, 2nd Lord de Ramsey (London 16 May 1848-8 May 1925)

6f) Fanny Octavia Louisa (29 Jan 1853-Guisachan 5 Aug 1904); m.London 9 Jun 1873 Edward Marjoribanks, 2nd Lord Tweedmouth (London 8 Jul 1849- Viceregal Lodge, Dublin 15 Sep 1909)

7f) Anne Emily (London 14 Nov 1854-London 20 Jun 1923); m.London 11 Jun 1874 James Henry Robert Innes-Ker, 7th Duke of Roxburghe (Floors Castle 5 Sep 1839-Floors Castle 23 Oct 1892)

8f) Charles Ashley (25 Nov 1856-11 Mar 1858)

9f) Augustus Robert (4 Jul 1858-12 May 1859)

10f) Georgiana Elizabeth (London 14 May 1860-Curzon House 9 Feb 1906); m.London 4 Jun 1883 Richard George Penn Curzon, 4th Earl Howe (London 28 Apr 1861-10 Jan 1929)

11f) Sarah Isabella Augusta (London 4 Jun 1865-22 Oct 1929); m.London 21 Nov 1891 Gordon Chesney Wilson (k.a.6 Nov 1914)

3e) Alfred (Garboldesham Hall 24 Apr 1824-London 21 Sep 1893); m.London 5 Feb 1857 Hon Harriet Louisa Hester Gough (Elvetham Park 5 Jul 1832-Elsenwood, Camberley 20 Jul 1901)

1f) Jane (London 2 Feb 1858-20 Jun 1940); m.London 5 Feb 1879 Sir Francis Salwey Winnington, 5th Bt. (24 Sep 1849-4 Mar 1931)

2f) Olivia (London 13 Jul 1859-28 May 1943); m.London 6 Nov 1883 Gen. Arthur Edward William Colville (20 Nov 1857-26 Feb 1942)

3f) Adeline (London 26 Oct 1860-10 Jan 1937); m.London 1 Aug 1895 William Hugh Williams (7 Oct 1857-20 Jan 1938)

4f) Violet (London 13 Jun 1864-22 Dec 1941); m.Cairo 20 Apr 1898 Charles Fitzclarence (8 May 1865-k.a.Ypern 12 Nov 1914)
